Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman took Arizona Diamondbacks right-hander Zac Gallen deep to left field for a two-run homer in his first at-bat back
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers plan on playing Freddie Freeman until his finger commands otherwise
Freddie Freeman feels reset after a trying month and wants to play every day
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman's return to the lineup was a welcome sight for the Dodgers, who took two of their three games against Baltimore and expanded their division lead to four games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers returned to the site of their latest October disappointment against the Arizona Diamondbacks at Chase Field, where they were swept out of last year's NLDS
Freddie Freeman's return to the lineup comes as the Dodgers try to separate themselves from the Diamondbacks and Padres in a division they have dominated for a decade
Others: Freddie Freeman's finger remains broken but can't get worse by playing
Freddie Freeman's son Maximus was hospitalized with Guillain-Barr√© syndrome, a rare neurological condition, and is still undergoing physical therapy
